Class Grid<T extends GameEntity>

java.lang.Object
com.aoopproject.framework.core.Grid<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of GameEntity this grid will hold.
public class Grid<T extends GameEntity> extends Object
Represents the game board as a 2D grid of GameEntity objects. This class is generic and can hold any type that extends GameEntity. It provides basic functionalities for accessing and modifying entities on the grid.

  • Constructor Details

    • Grid

      public Grid(int rows, int columns)
      Constructs a new Grid with the specified number of rows and columns. Initializes all cells to null.
      Parameters:
      rows - The number of rows in the grid. Must be positive.
      columns - The number of columns in the grid. Must be positive.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if rows or columns are not positive.

    • Grid

      public Grid(int rows, int columns, Supplier<T> entitySupplier)
      Constructs a new Grid and initializes each cell using the provided entity supplier.
      Parameters:
      rows - The number of rows in the grid.
      columns - The number of columns in the grid.
      entitySupplier - A supplier function that provides an instance of T for each cell. This is called for each cell (rows * columns times).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if rows or columns are not positive.

  • Method Details

    • getEntity

      public T getEntity(int row, int column)
      Gets the entity at the specified row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index (0-based).
      column - The column index (0-based).
      Returns:
      The entity at the specified position, or null if the cell is empty or coordinates are out of bounds.

    • setEntity

      public void setEntity(int row, int column, T entity)
      Sets the entity at the specified row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index (0-based).
      column - The column index (0-based).
      entity - The entity to place in the cell. Can be null to represent an empty cell.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the coordinates are invalid.

    • getRows

      public int getRows()
      Gets the number of rows in the grid.
      Returns:
      The number of rows.

    • getColumns

      public int getColumns()
      Gets the number of columns in the grid.
      Returns:
      The number of columns.

    • isValidCoordinate

      public boolean isValidCoordinate(int row, int column)
      Checks if the given coordinates are within the bounds of the grid.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index.
      column - The column index.
      Returns:
      true if the coordinates are valid, false otherwise.

    • fill

      public void fill(Supplier<T> entitySupplier)
      Fills the entire grid with entities provided by the supplier. This will overwrite any existing entities.
      Parameters:
      entitySupplier - A function that supplies a new entity for each cell.

    • deepCopy

      public Grid<T> deepCopy(Function<T,T> entityCopier)
      Creates a deep copy of this grid. Each entity in the grid is copied using the provided entity copier function.
      Parameters:
      entityCopier - A function that takes an entity of type T and returns a deep copy of it.
      Returns:
      A new Grid instance containing deep copies of all entities.
